article: on the day that bertelsmann , the german media conglomerate , quelled weeks of speculation by announcing that markus unk , head of the company 's printing unit , would take over as chief executive of random house , industry executives were largely reserving judgment on what it will mean to have a relative outsider in charge of the world 's largest publisher of consumer titles .
abstract: bertelsmann picks a publishing industry outsider to head random house
